Jangan Nyalakan Api! Ini Cara Cegah Septic Tank Meledak Saat Bersihkan Tinja
06 Nov 2019, 14:02 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
Jakarta - Ledakan septic tank di Cakung, Jakarta Timur yang menewaskan satu orang berawal dari ulah petugas pembersih tinja yang membakar koran. Aksinya itu adalah untuk memastikan proses sudah selesai. Padahal, caranya itu adalah ide nyeleneh.
Sebagaimana diketahui, saat itu korban berinisial SI ingin menyakinkan pemilik rumah bahwa septic tank sudah bersih dari gas usai disedot. SI memastikannya dengan membakar koran.
"Yang terjadi kemarin, dia sudah memompa. Dia beranggapan gasnya sudah kosong. Dia kemudian membakar kertas koran untuk memastikan gas sudah kosong. Nah itu suatu kecerobohan yang luar biasa. Tidak ada itu prosedur seperti itu di dalam konsep septic tank. Itu justru memancing bahaya. Membakar koran di septic tank itu ide yang nyeleneh," kata Peneliti Utama Teknologi Lingkungan di Loka Penelitian Teknologi Bersih LIPI, Neni Sintawardani saat dihubungi detikcom, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Neni menduga, saat koran di bakar, gas metana masih masih ada di dalam septic tank. Padahal, gas metana sangat mudah terbakar. Jadi, menurutnya, secara otomatis gas akan meledak.
"Pada saat cairan diambil, kemungkinan biogas (gas metana) masih ada di situ, di ruang kosongnya. Saat itu dimasukkan api, ya otomatis meledak. Ledakan itu juga tentu akan cukup kuat karena ada apinya. Sampai bisa menghancurkan konstruksi bangunan tertentu," paparnya.

Don't Light a Fire! This Is How To Prevent The Septic Tank Explodes When Clean The Feces
06 Nov 2019, 14:02 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
Jakarta - The explosion of a septic tank in Cakung, East Jakarta, which killed one person, started from the stool cleaning officer who burned a newspaper. The action is to ensure the process is complete. In fact, the way it is an eccentric idea.
As is known, at that time the victim initials SI wanted to convince homeowners that the septic tank was clean from gas after being sucked up. SI confirms it by burning newspapers.
"What happened yesterday, he had pumped. He thought the gas was empty. He then burned newspaper to make sure the gas was empty. Now that was an extraordinary carelessness. There was no such procedure in the concept of a septic tank. "Burning a newspaper in a septic tank is a strange idea," said Principal Researcher of Environmental Technology at the LIPI Clean Technology Research Station, Neni Sintawardani when contacted by AFP on Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Neni suspected, when the newspaper was burned, methane gas was still in the septic tank. In fact, methane gas is very flammable. So, according to him, gas will automatically explode.
"When the liquid is taken, the possibility of biogas (methane gas) is still there, in the empty space. When it is put on fire, it will automatically explode. The explosion will also be quite strong because of the fire. Until it can destroy certain building construction," he explained .
